events.message: Customer reported a vehicle collision that occurred during heavy rain, leading to significant front-end damage.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident, confirming it involves a front-end car collision.
An agent specializing in auto claims was assigned to manage this vehicle accident claim and initiate contact with the client.
The client was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the auto accident claim and informed about the next steps.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the vehicle damage, police report, and insurance policy details to proceed.
The required photos, police report, and other documents were successfully received from the customer for claim verification.
An initial investigation was launched including verification of police report and damage assessment by an assigned adjuster.
Investigation confirmed the extent of collision damage and liability was attributed to a third party at the traffic junction.
A settlement figure was proposed to the customer covering repair costs and compensation for the vehicle damage.
The customer responded positively, agreeing with the proposed settlement and thanking the company for efficient handling.
The claim was formally approved by the claims department allowing disbursement of the agreed settlement amount.
Payment covering the vehicle repair was processed and sent to the customer's bank account as per agreed terms.
The claim was officially closed following successful payment and confirmation of repair work completion by the customer.
